args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- The permutation matrix associated to a permutation of `Fin n`. -/
def permutation_matrix {n : â„•} {F : Type*} [Field F] (Ïƒ : Equiv.Perm (Fin n)) :
  Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) F :=
  fun i j => if j = Ïƒ i then (1 : F) else 0

/-- Let G be a group, n âˆˆ â„•, and F a field. Any permutation representation
    `Î´ : G â†’ S_n` gives rise to a matrix representation `Ï : G â†’ GL_n(F)` by
    sending `g` to the permutation matrix `permutation_matrix (Î´ g)`. -/
theorem permutation_representation_to_matrix_representation {G : Type*} [Group G]
  (n : â„•) (F : Type*) [Field F] (Î´ : G â†’ Equiv.Perm (Fin n)) :
  âˆƒ Ï : G â†’ (Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) F)Ë£, âˆ€ g, (Ï g : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) F) = permutation_matrix (Î´ g) := by
  sorry
